title: Emir Dautović
text:
Emir Dautović (born 5 February 1995) is a Slovenian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> who plays for SC Kaldorf in Austria.
Club career.
He began his career in <a href="Trbovlje">Trbovlje</a>, where he played for <a href="NK%20Rudar%20Trbovlje">Rudar Trbovlje</a> youth selections until 2010, when he transferred to <a href="NK%20Maribor">Maribor</a>. Dautović, who plays as a central defender, was regarded as one of the biggest talents of the Slovenian football in 2012. He made his professional debut for <a href="OFK%20Beograd">OFK Beograd</a> in <a href="Serbian%20SuperLiga">Jelen SuperLiga</a> home win against <a href="FK%20Mladost%20Lu%C4%8Dani">Mladost Lučani</a> on 23 November 2014.
International career.
Dautović was a member of the <a href="Slovenia%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Slovenia national under-19 football team</a>. He appeared with the <a href="Slovenia%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">under-17</a> squad at the <a href="2012%20UEFA%20European%20Under-17%20Football%20Championship">2012 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship</a>, where he played on all three group matches for his side, receiving one red card in the process.
